conclusion: Break down the problem into necessary steps and analyze each component.
Two resistors R are connected in parallel between points AB and CD.
The resistor R between AB is marked as one through which the Joule heat Q is generated.
The other resistor R between CD will also generate Joule heat due to the current flowing through it.
Calculate the equivalent resistance R_eq for two resistors in parallel: R_eq = R/2.
Let the initial velocity of the conductor rod MN be v_0.
Calculate the induced EMF due to the motion of the rod: E = BLv_0.
Calculate the current I using Ohm's law: I = 2BLv_0/R.
Divide the current equally between the two resistors: I_R = BLv_0/R.
Calculate the Joule heat Q generated in resistor R: Q = (BLv_0)^2/R * t.
The rod reaches the rightmost end for the first time after a certain time t.
Express the heat in terms of the initial velocity v_0: Q = (BLv_0)^2/R * t.
Calculate the Ampere force F on the rod at the initial moment: F = 2B^2L^2v_0/R.
The magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod at the initial moment is 2B^2L^2v_0/R.
